title: It's one thing to not be able to move through minions.
body: It's another thing entirely for your champion to have a seizure in the creep wave because they're constantly recalculating their pathing. This has been going on since forever, people have been asking for this to be addressed since forever, and it's still a thing.

I agree with this. Typically, the only reason body-blocking of any sort exists in strategy games or MOBAs is because it is meant to be a baseline form of crowd control tanks can apply via their larger hitboxes. Dota 2 and HotS capitalize on this by making body-blocking a core component to tanking, while also making pathing around creeps so smooth that they never feel like an encumbrance. By contrast, League doesn't really put any significant emphasis on body-blocking between champions (which could be a much sounder way of giving tanks baseline usefulness than to give them raw damage), but creep block is nonetheless a real problem in top lane, whereas the game's occasional pathing problems sometimes feel like there's still some legacy code that needs to be updated. This I think is also why a lot of champions have been given either mobility or the ability to ghost through units (or both), as maneuvering in lane would otherwise feel bad.

Personally, I'd be in favor of a reversal of unit block, where champions could block each other much more clearly in proportion to their hitboxes, but where there would be no creep block at all, at least not allied creep block, and not with the game's current pathing. Features are only good to a game insofar as they enable good gameplay, and so far creep block feels like it has done more harm than good. If it is there to balance certain champions, then it would be better to address those champion directly than to have them rely on a dysfunctional mechanic.

I would be completely down for the removal of allied creep block. It's beyond dumb when your minions bunch up to help you because a champion attacked you, and end up blocking you and getting you killed.

The problem is that the game is balanced around creep block, riot have said so themselves. Removing allied creep block would be a big buff to ranged toplaners who can hide behind their minions, poke you down, then run behind their casters to drop aggro. 
What needs to be done is that the code of minion pathings needed to be fixed because it's so bad that its embarrassing. Also minion pinning, which I'm counting as when minions pin you to a wall where you can't move, needs to be completely removed.

Riot has 2 things they can do with minion block:
1.Enchance and rework it. Make it matter to the game, and focus some decision making skills to it. (For example in Dota you can stand behind your minions and block their path a bit. If you do it good first wave starts a lot closer to your tower and gives you a push advantage.) While this would be hard to do, it would increase skill ceiling and provide a lot more strategic depth to the game and passives that remove minion block would actualy become important (Kassadin, Fizz). 
I personaly think this is a better one.

2.Complete removal or significant reduction. Still a better solution then this one, where its just an outdated system that is not fun for anybody.

I think its a technical issue that's hard to deal with, since in many games, pathing and collision has been a problem. 

I don't know what it is, I'm not tech savvy, but its just an observation. 

But I think part of it makes sense. Sure, its a bit annoying when you are stuck in a creepwave and you're having a spasm. But say in a movie, there's a chase scene, you won't see the guys run through a huge crowd of people when there's a much emptier space next to them. 

Minions do act as a bit of a block as is, since attacking champions when you are next to a massive creepwave will get you aggro. 

If there are ways to make the mechanism cleaner then by all means, but I think its not too much of a problem. 

Besides, why else would we have Fizz passive?
